Name: da ji
Other name: Prescription names: da ji, da ji cao, da ji gen, da ji tan, xian da ji, ci ji

Maladies Treated: Uterine bleeding not during menses (血崩).
Intestinal wind presenting as intestinal pain (腸風).
Boils and carbuncles; swellings and toxic sores (癰瘍腫毒).
Medical Function: Arrests bleeding (hemostatic); the hemostatic effect is stronger when processed into da ji tan (charred).
Dosage:
Decoction (internal): 15–30 g.
External use: use appropriate amount of the fresh herb; smash and apply to affected areas.
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of pi xu (spleen deficiency) when there is no blood stasis.
Notes: Da ji tan (da ji charcoal) is prepared by cutting the herb, sun-drying, then stir-frying over high heat until dark/charred while preserving the herb’s nature (存性).

Fresh leaves: Pectolinarin, about 2.1% (also described as 6-methoxy-derivative; 6-甲氧基柳穿魚式〔即大薊苷, pectolinarin〕).
6,4'-dimethoxyscutellarein-7-rhamnoglucoside (6，4'-二甲氧基黃芩素-7-鼠李葡萄糖苷).
Pectinarigenin (柳穿魚素): 5,7-dihydroxy-6,4'-dimethoxyflavone (5,7-二羥基-6,4'-二甲氧基黃酮).
Whole plant: Shows reactions indicating presence of alkaloids.
Shows reactions indicating presence of volatile (evaporating) oil.

Smash and apply to affected areas.15～30克；外用鮮品適量，搗爛效患處。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕shi tan san 十炭散Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Do not use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) and without blood stasis.脾虛而無血淤者忌服。　 Da ji tan (da ji charcoal) is the herb that has been cut, dried under the sun and  stir-fried till dark (but still preserving the property of the herb). Its function of arresting bleeding is stronger. 大薊炭為大薊切碎晒乾，用武火炒至焦黑色（存性）入藥者。止血作用增強。 Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressProblems with website? Name: ma dou ling
qing mu xiang
tian xian teng
Other name: Qing mu xiang (root of the plant ma dou ling)
Tian xian teng (vine of ma dou ling)
Ma dou ling (fruit of the plant)
Guang fang ji (belongs to the Aristolochiaceae; toxic to kidneys; also called Guangdong mu fang ji when produced in Guangdong)

Geography: south of Yangtse river valley areas
Properties: Root (tu qing mu xiang) is warm
Usually non-toxic at normal dosage, but long-term usage with larger amount can be toxic; highly sensitive individuals can have kidney toxicity even with small amounts
Maladies Treated: Phlegm with wheezing due to lung heat
Chronic cough due to lung deficiency (feixu), with blood in phlegm
Hypertension with dizziness and red face due to yinxu and liver yang ascending (gan yang ascending)
Medical Function: Counters bronchospastic effect of pilocarpine, acetylcholine, and histamine
Inhibitory effect in culture against Staphylococcus aureus
Dosage: Internal: 3–10 g in decoction. External: appropriate amount; boil with water and use the decoction for washing affected parts.
Contraindications:
Do not use for cough or asthma due to cold and deficiency (xu han). Do not use for diarrhea due to pixu (spleen deficiency). Large dosage and/or long-term use can cause kidney damage and can be lethal. Contraindicated in pregnancy. 
 Guang fang ji (Aristolochia) is toxic to the kidneys; fresh stems, leaves, or flowers, if mistakenly ingested by humans or livestock, can cause headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dyspnea, and limb numbness; 30 g is a toxic dose. 
 The health authority of Taiwan has banned herbs containing aristolochic acid: ma dou ling, guan mu tong, tian xian teng, qing mu xiang, and guang fang ji; all manufactured herb products containing aristolochic acid have been banned in mainland China. Check local health regulations before use.
Research: According to a study in California, herbs labeled as Akebia trifoliata Koiz. var. australis Rehd. (bai mu tong 白木通) were actually Aristolochia debilis (Aristolochia manshuriensis), which contain aristolochic acid. These herbs contain aristolochic acid and are all toxic to the kidneys.
Notes:
Guang fang ji 廣防己 is produced in Guangdong and is also called Guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己. It belongs to the aristolochiae family and is toxic to the kidneys; 30 g is the toxic dosage. Fresh stems, leaves, or flowers, if mistakenly ingested by humans or livestock, can cause headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dyspnea, and limb numbness.
Before the Qing dynasty, mu tong was derived from Akebia guinata or Akebia lobata, but now ninety-five percent of mu tong (guan mu tong 關木通) used in China is the stem of Aristolochia debilis, usually obtained from the northeastern province, formerly called Manchuria.
Different varieties related to ma dou ling listed: 北馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia contorta), 瓜葉馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia cucurbitilolia), 馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia debilis), 廣防己 (Aristolochia fangchi), 採花馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia elegans), 大葉馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia kaemferi), 台灣馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia shimadai), 綿毛馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia mollissima), 穆坪馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia moupinensis), 銳葉馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia tagala), 港口馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia kankauensis Sasaki), 琉球馬兜鈴 (Aristolochia liukiuensis hatus), 南木香 (Aristolochia yunnanensis Franch.).
Other herbs in the Aristolochia genus mentioned: 硃砂蓮 (Aristolochia cinnabarina CY Cheng et JL.Wu), 尋骨風 (Aristolochia mollissima Hance), 青香藤/柔毛馬兜鈴/青木香 (Aristolochia mollis Dunn), 南木香 (Aristolochia yunnanensis Franch.), 通城虎 (Aristolochia fordiana Hemsley), 假大薯, 管南香, 廣防己 (Aristolochia westlandi, Hemsl.), 鼻血雷, 白金古欖.
The health authority of Taiwan has banned herbs containing aristolochic acid: ma dou ling, guan mu tong, tian xian teng, qing mu xiang, and guang fang ji. All manufactured herb products containing aristolochic acid have been banned in mainland China.
Original Text:
ma dou ling

ma dou ling 馬兜玲， qing mu xiang 青木香，tian xian teng 天仙藤by Joe Hing Kwok Chu     (in English and Chinese 中英文)Click here to see picture of herb. 按此看圖。Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕
Fructus aristolochiaBiological name:拉丁文學名 ﹕
Aristolochia debilis Sieb et Zucc;
Aristolochia sinarum Linde.;
Aristolochia contorta BgePron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕
ba to reiPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕
ma du ryongPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕
maa4 dau1 ling4Other Names:別名﹕
Qing mu xiang 青木香 is the root of the plant ma dou ling.
Tian xian teng 天仙藤 is the vine of ma dou ling.
Ma dou ling is the fruit of the plant
Guang fang ji  belongs to the aristolochiae family. [note]
These herbs  contain aristolochic acid and are all toxic to the kidneys like ma dou ling.
青木香是馬兜玲的根。天仙藤是馬兜玲的藤。廣防己是属于馬兜玲科的植物。都含馬兜玲酸，對腎臟有毒。Common Name:英文名﹕
birthwort fruit (closest species)Distribution:產地﹕
Hao Zhou of Anhui, northeastern and northern provinces, and Hubei, Henan, Hebei, Shaanxi, Gansu, Ningxia, Shandong, Jiangxi, Jiangxi, Shanxi,  Jiangsu and Zhejiang and south of Yangtse river valley areas. 
分佈於安徽毫州，東北部和北部各省，湖北，河南，河北，陝西，甘肅，寧夏，山東，江西，江西，山西，江蘇，浙江與長江流域以南地區。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕
Bitter in taste. A little spicy. Ma dou ling fruit are cold, but the roots, which are called tu qing mu xiang, are warm. Usually normal dosage is not toxic but long term usage with larger amount can be toxic, and in some highly sensitive individuals, a small amount can be very toxic to the kidneys.Medical functions:
Bronchodilatory effect
Counter bronchospastic effect of pilocarpine, acetylcholine, and histamine.
Inhibitory effect (in culture) against Staphylococcus aureus.
Mild counter- hypertension effect.
擴張支氣管作用抑制支氣管痙攣的毛果芸香鹼作用抑制乙酰膽鹼作用抑制組胺的作用 在培養液中，對金黃色葡萄球菌的抑制作用 輕度抑制高血壓的作用Channels (meridians) entered:歸經﹕
 lung and large intestine channels.
肺﹐大腸。Actions & Indications:主治﹕
in coughs, phlegm, wheezing, blood in phlegm, with lung heat;
hypertension, dizziness, with red face due to yinxu and liver yang ascending (gan yang ascending) condition;
bleeding hemorrhoids and swelling in the anus. 
用於肺熱咳嗽﹐痰壅氣促﹐肺虛久咳﹐痰中帶血﹐
用於因陰虛﹐ 肝陽上亢高血壓病，頭暈面赤者,
痔瘡腫痛或出血﹐肛門周圍腫痛等。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕
aristolochic acid, aristolochine C32H32N2O18 , magnoflorine

馬兜鈴酸，馬兜鈴鹼，木蘭花鹼。
Normal Dosage:用量﹕
3 to 10 g in decoction. Use appropriate amount for external use: boil with water and use for washing affected parts.
內服入煎劑，常用量3～10克。外用 適量：煎汁熏洗。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕ Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Cautions:禁忌﹕
Do not use in cough due to cold and deficiency or weakness.
Do not use in diarrhea due to pixu (spleen deficiency).
Large dosage and long term usage can cause damage to kidneys and can be lethal.
Do not use in cases of pregnancy.

Note:
Guang fang ji is produced in Guangdong.  It is also called Guangdong mu fang ji. It belongs to the aristolochiae family and is toxic for the kidneys. 30 g is the toxic dosage.
According to a study in California, the herbs labeled as Akebia trifoliata Koiz. var. australis Rehd. (bai mu tong白木通)-- all of them are actually Aristolochia debilis (Aristolochia  manshuriensis) which contain aristolochia acid.
虛寒咳喘﹐
脾虚便 泄者慎服，
大劑量或久服可致腎臟衰竭或死亡。
孕婦忌服。
廣防己屬馬兜苓科﹐全株有 毒。人畜 誤食新鮮的莖葉或花，會造成頭痛﹐頭暈﹐噁心﹐嘔吐﹐腹痛﹐呼吸困難﹐四肢麻木等症狀。廣防己對 腎 臟有毒。30克的劑量即為有毒劑量。  [note]: Before the Qing dynasty mu tong was derived from the plant of Akebia guinata or Akebia lobata, but now ninety-five percent of mu tong (guan mu tong 關木通) used in China is the stem of Aristolochia debilis, usually obtained from the northeastern province, formally called Manchuria.These are different varieties of ma duo ling: [1]
北馬兜鈴（Aristolchia contorta） 瓜葉馬兜鈴（Aristolchia cucurbitilolia） 馬兜鈴（Aristolchia debilis） 廣防己（Aristolchia fangchi） 採花馬兜鈴（Aristolchia elegans） 大葉馬兜鈴（Aristolchia kaemferi） 台灣馬兜鈴（Aristolchia shimadai） 綿毛馬兜鈴（Aristolchia mollissima） 穆坪馬兜鈴（Aristolchia moupinensis） 銳葉馬兜鈴（Aristolchia tagala） 港口馬兜鈴（Aristolchia kankauensis Sasaki） 琉球馬兜鈴（Aristolchia liukiuensis hatus） 
南木香            
      

      (Aristolochia yunnanensis Franch.) 
The following herbs that contain Aristolochic acid have been ban by the health office of Taiwan government: ma dou ling, guan mu tong, tian xian teng, qing mu xiang, and guang fang ji.
All manufactured herb containing Aristolochic acid has been banned in mainland China.
Other herbs that belong to the Aristolochia family include:
zhu sha lian 硃砂蓮(Aristolochia cinnabarina CY Cheng et JL.Wu),
xun gu feng 尋骨風 ﹐(Aristolochia mollissima Hance), 
qing xiang teng 青香藤, 柔毛馬兜鈴, 青木香 (Aristolochia mollis Dunn),
nan mu xiang 南木香, 
 
      

      (Aristolochia yunnanensis Franch.) 
tong cheng fu 通城虎, (Aristolochia fordiana Hemsley)
jia da shu 假大薯,
guan nan xiang 管南香,
Guang fang ji 
      廣防己 (Aristolochia westlandi, Hemsl.)
bi xue lei 鼻血雷,
bai jin gu lan 白金古欖.
Check your local health regulation before using them.
臺湾衛生署中醫藥委員會已宣布禁用含馬兜鈴酸的馬兜鈴﹐關木通﹐天仙藤﹐青木香﹐廣防己等五種 藥 材及其製劑.
其它已知的馬兜鈴科馬兜鈴屬中藥材還有廣防己﹐朱砂蓮﹐尋骨風﹐青香藤﹐南木香﹐通城虎﹐假大薯﹐管南香﹐鼻血雷﹐白金古欖。

Last update: Sept 8, 2013; 12:38
a.m. LAH

Geography: Guangxi (China) — Geckos from Guilin are considered the best
Maladies Treated: Kidney yang deficiency (shen yang xu, 腎陽虚)
Medical Function: Tonifies the Kidneys and the Lungs
Corrects shen yang xu (kidney yang deficiency)
Contraindications:
Do not use in cases of wheezing and coughing from cold or flu infection due to acute infection.
Counterfeits are reported in the market; see Research and [1].
Research:
The extract of ge jie possesses the effect of inhibition toward the growth of liver cancer cell line HepG-2. [2]

Modern research: It has a weak androgen effect on the prostates and testes of mice; increases the weight of testes; extends the mating period.

Pharmacognostic Identification of Gecko (Gekko gecko) and Its Counterfeits on Characteristics of Crude Drug and Original Animal of 18 Samples (Zhu Hua, Guangxi College of TCM, Nanning 530001 China; Ren Renan, Nanjing University of TCM, Nanjing 210029 China). Abstract: Objective: To identify medicinal material Gecko and its counterfeits. Methods: Commodity Gecko were investigated and 18 samples of different kinds of commercial Gecko were collected from markets in China; their characteristics of crude drug and original animal were measured and compared. Results: Of the 18 samples, 2 were Gecko (Gekko gecko L.) and 16 were its counterfeits. Conclusion: There are many Gecko counterfeits in the markets of China; they can be identified by examining appearance, characteristics of crude drug and original animal. Key Words: Gecko; Gekko gecko; Identification; Counterfeit Material; Pharmacognosy; Gecko Characteristic.
References: [2] Nanning, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Cancer Prevention Institute ", Guangxi Medical University Graduate School
[2] 南宁, 广西壮族自治区肿瘤防治研究所", 广西医科大学研究生学院
Further Reading: Pharmacognostic Identification of Gecko (Gekko gecko) and Its Counterfeits on Characteristics of Crude Drug and Original Animal of 18 Samples. Zhu Hua, Guangxi College of TCM, Nanning 530001 China; Ren Renan, Nanjing University of TCM, Nanjing 210029 China.
Original Text:
ge jie

ge jie (gecko) 蛤蚧Translated and edited by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu
Pharmaceutical name:英文药名：GeckoZoological name:拉丁動物學名：Gekko gecko;Phrynosoma cornuta Horned toadPron. in Japanese:日語發音：gokaiPron. in Korean:韓語發音：hapkae Pron. in Cantonese:粤語發音：gap3 gaai3Common Name:英文名：geckoDistribution:分佈：Guangxi, Guangdong, Shanxi, Yunna, Jiangsu provinces of China. Vietnam, Thailand and other parts of Indo-China, and Indonesia. Geckos  from Guilin of Guangxi are considered the best.廣西，廣東，山西，云南，江蘇等省，越南，泰國 與其他中南半島地區。廣西桂林産的認為最好。Properties (characteristics)salty, neutral, slightly toxic性 咸 ， 平 。 有 小 毒 。Channels (meridians) entered:lung, kidney入 肺 、 腎 經 。Actions & Indications:tonifies kidneys and the lungs: in wheezing, consumptive cough or cough with blood in sputum, impotence, correct shenyangxu (kidney deficient).補肺，腎。用於百日咳，肺痨咳嗽，咳痰有血，陽萎，腎陽虚。Medical Function:
The extract of ge jie possesses the effect of inhibition 
    toward the growth of  liver cancer cell of HepG02. 
[2]
對肝癌HepG-2 細胞的生長有抑制作用。【2】Chemical ingredients:　Meat contains:肉含：carnosine肌肽choline膽鹼carnitine肉毒鹼guanine鳥嘌呤protein蛋白質fat脂肪Liver contains:肝含：metyl thiophosphorsäureester甲基對硫酮methyl　parathion GSH S-methyl transferase還原性谷胱甘肽-S-甲基轉移 酶glutathion谷胱甘肽Thyroids contain:甲狀腺含：thyroxine甲狀腺素iodotyrosine碘酪氨酸Dosage:用量：3 to 7 g as powder; 9 to 15 g in decoction.粉剤：3∼7克。湯剤：9∼15克。Samples of formulae:處方舉例：to be loadedModern Research:現代研究：It has a weak androgen effect  on the prostates and testes of mice;  and increase the weight of testes and their mating period.對小鼠有雄激素作用於前列腺，睾丸。增加睾丸重量。延長交尾期。Cautions:禁忌：not to use in case of wheezing and coughing from cold or flu infection due to acute infection.See below on counterfeits.有 熱 症 兼 火 盛 忌 用 。市場上所賣的很多是假貨。【1】
[1] http://www.yxlw.org/html/yao/fangji/20090906/23284.html
[2] Nanning, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Cancer 
    Prevention Institute "
    , Guangxi Medical University Graduate School
[2] 南宁,
    广西壮族自治区肿瘤防治研究所", 
广西医科大学研究生学院Pharmacognostic Identification of Gecko (Gekko gecko ) and  Its Counterfeits on Characteristics of Crude  Drug and Original Animal of 18 SamplesZhu Hua Guangxi College of TCM, Nanning 530001 China Ren Renan Nanjing University of TCM, Nanjing 210029 ChinaAbstract　Objective: To identify medicinal material Gecko and its counterfeits. Methods: The commodity Gecko were investigated and 18 samples of different kinds commercial Gecko were collected from markets in China . Their characteristics of crude drug and original animal were measured and compared. Results: Of all the 18 samples, 2 were Gecko (Gekko gecko L.) and 16 were its counterfeits. Conclusion: There are many Gecko counterfeits in the markets of China. They can be identified by examining their appearance, characteristic of crude drug and original animal, according to the above results of studies. Key Words: Gecko; Gekko gecko; Identification; Counterfeit Material; Pharmacognosy; Gecko Characteristic

Maladies Treated: Chronic cough due to lung yin deficiency
Cough due to exterior wind cold
Cough with difficulty in expelling phlegm
Cough and expectoration not smooth (咳吐不爽)
Cough and spitting pus and blood (咳吐膿血)
Chronic cough not healing (肺虛久咳)
Medical Function: The decoction and extract can expel phlegm and soothe cough.
Antibacterial: the decoction and extract can inhibit E. coli, Shigella dysenteriae, Bacillus paratyphosus, and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
Dosage: 5 to 10 g in decoction (5～10克, 入煎劑).
Samples of Formulae: bai qian tang 白前湯 (Bai Qian Tang/Cynanchum decoction)
Contraindications: Do not use with Fu Zi (prepared aconite accessory root), Cao Wu (wild aconite root), Ju Mai/Qu Mai (Dianthus), Lei Wan (Omphalia sclerotium), Yuan Zhi (polygala root); incompatible with Yin Chen Hao (capillaris wormwood). For dry cough and coughing blood due to yin deficiency with exuberant fire (陰虛火旺之燥咳，咳血) and for cough with heat (實熱咳嗽), do not use zi wan by itself.
Chemical Ingredients: Astersaponins: astersaponin A, B, C, D, E, F, G.
Asterprosaponin: product after hydrolyzing astersaponin (紫菀皂苷水解後得紫菀次皂苷).
Hederasaponin: product after hydrolyzing again from asterprosaponin (再水解後得常春藤皂苷元).
Shionosides A, B (紫菀苷 A, B).
Asterin A, B (紫菀五太 A, B).
Astin A, B, C (紫菀苷 A, B, C).

cao 返魂草，ruan zi wan 軟紫菀，zi wan rong 紫菀茸，zi qing 紫倩，ye quan niu 夜牽牛。Common Name:英文名﹕purple aster rootDistribution:產地﹕ Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, acrid, slightly warm味苦，辛 ， 性溫。Channels cough due to lung yin deficiency, cough due to exterior wind cold, cough with difficulty in expelling  phlegm, blood in sputum, cough and spitting pus and blood,  chronic bronchitis, chronic cough not healing, dark urine, difficulty in urination.肺陰虚之慢性咳嗽，咯痰不爽，肺虛久咳，寒咳，痰涎壅塞，咳吐不爽，痰中帶血，咳吐膿血，慢性氣管炎，肺結核咳嗽，尿赤 ﹐小便不利 。  。 Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕紫菀皂苷 astersaponin A, B, C, D, E, F, G,紫菀皂苷水解後得紫菀次皂苷 asterprosaponin (product after hydrolyzing astersaponin,再水解後得常春藤皂苷元 hederasaponin (product after hydrolyzing again),紫菀酮 shionone,槲皮素 quercetin,無羈萜 friedelin,表無羈萜醇 epifriedelinol, 紫菀苷 A, B shionosides A, B,紫菀五太 A, B  asterin A, B, 環氯素 cyclochlorotine,紫菀苷 A, B, C astin A, B, C,毛葉醇 lachnophyllol,乙酸毛葉醇 lachnophyllol acetate, 茴香醚 anethole.Dosage:用量﹕ 5 to 10 g in decoction.5～10克 .入煎劑。Samples of Those who cough, and coughing blood due to yinxu (yin deficient) with high heat, and those who have cough with heat, do not use zi wan by itself.惡附 子，草烏，瞿 麥，雷丸，遠志；畏茵陳。陰虛火旺之燥咳，咳血及實熱咳嗽者不宜單獨使用。  　Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告  A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading              in progressClick here for comment. Geography: Habitat: grassy swampy areas; running ditches; shaded moist places.
Maladies Treated: Gastroenteritis / digestive inflammation (internal use; whole herb decoction).
Rheumatoid arthritis / 風濕關節痛 (internal use; whole herb decoction).
Impact injuries with swelling and pain (跌打腫痛) (internal use; whole herb decoction).

Functional vaginal bleeding [1]: vaginal bleeding without obvious sexual organ disease caused by hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis dysfunction; called “gong xue bing” (功能病) in Chinese (internal use; whole herb decoction).
Snake bites (external use: wash the affected area with the decoction).
Eczema (external use: wash the affected area with the decoction).
Medical Function: Dispel wind and promote draining of dampness (祛風利濕).
Disperse blood stasis and stop pain (散瘀止痛).
Clear toxin and reduce swelling (解毒消腫).
Kill parasites and relieve itching (殺虫止痒).
Dosage:
Internal decoction: 15–30 g.
External: appropriate amount; use the decoction to wash the affected area.
Contraindications: Toxic. Symptoms of toxicity include gastrointestinal irritation such as vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and blood in urine (hematuria), etc.
Research: Determination of Gallic Acid in Polygonum Flaccidum Meisn by HPLC. Journal: 海峽藥學, 2006, Vol. 18, Issue 02. Authors: 賴東美, 施連印. ISSN: 1006-3765. Pages: (2006)02-0050-03. Method: Agilent Hypersil ODS column (4.0×250 mm, 5 μm); mobile phase: methanol–water–glacial acetic acid; detection wavelength: 274 nm. Results: mean recovery of gallic acid 100.7%, RSD 1.0% (n=6). Conclusion: the method is simple, fast, and accurate, and can be used for quality control of 辣蓼.
Notes: [1] Functional vaginal bleeding: Vaginal bleeding with no obvious sexual organ disease but caused by hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis dysfunction, is called 'gong xue bing' (功血病) in Chinese.
References: [1] Determination of Gallic Acid in Polygonum Flaccidum Meisn by HPLC. 海峽藥學. 2006年 第18卷 第02期, pages (2006)02-0050-03. Authors: 賴東美, 施連印. ISSN: 1006-3765.

Being used in dysentery, diarrhea, digestive inflammation,  rheumatoid arthritis, impact injuries and swelling, functional vaginal bleeding [1], in external use: snake bites, eczema.祛風利濕，散瘀止痛，解毒消腫，殺虫止痒。用於痢疾，胃腸炎，腹瀉，風濕關節痛，跌打腫痛，功能性子宮出血；外用治毒蛇咬傷，皮膚濕疹。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕Contains large amount of oxalic acid, oxalate,dianthraquinone, dianthrone. Also contain flavonoids, alkaloids, evaporating oil, gallic acid, tannin.含大量的草酸、草酸鹽；二蒽醌(dianthraquinone)、二蒽酮(dianthrone)等刺激性成分，此外還有黃酮、生物鹼、揮發油、没食子酸、鞣質等成分Dosage:用量﹕For decoction for oral intake: 15 to 30 g.For external use: use appropriate amount. Wash affected area with decoction.15~30克；外用適量，煎水洗。  Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕ Modern Research:現代研究﹕Determination of Gallic Acid in Polygonum Flaccidum Meisn by HPLC  <<海峽藥學>>2006年 第18卷 第02期 作者: 賴東美, 施連印,  期刊 ISSN : 1006-3765(2006)02-0050-03 目的建立辣蓼中沒食子酸的含量測定方法.方法採用Agilent Hypersil ODS柱(4.0�250mm,5μm);以甲醇-水-冰醋酸為流動相;檢測波長:274nm.結果沒食子酸的平均回收率為100.7%,RSD為 1.0%(n=6).結論方法簡便、快速、准確,可用於辣蓼的質量控制.Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Symptoms of toxicity: irritation in the digestive system, like: vomiting, pain in abdomen, diarrhea, blood in urine etc.中毒主要表現為消化系統的刺激症狀，如嘔吐、腹痛、腹瀉、血尿等。【摘錄】《全國中草藥匯編》 [1] Vaginal bleeding, with no obvious sexual organ disease but caused by hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis dysfunction, is called "gong xue bing" (功能病) in Chinese. Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告   A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressProblems with website?
